nodes.bodyText: Please print git status before sleep, to show contributors what is left

   ;;

+    echo "There are changes in files after clone, recheck .gitattributes file"
+    sleep 5s

Sorry looks I was not attentive on merge on this status check.
https://travis-ci.org/github/checkstyle/checkstyle/jobs/685191959
It should not be separate build item, it should be part of post build actions.
Please refactor travis.yml .
Please make second commit, that cause some file creation in git in some existing build to make sure build catch it and fail.

nodes.bodyText:
No need to grep here. It is not a stable approach.
Please use git status --porcelain=v1 --untracked-files=normal instead. Here and in all such cases.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,15 @@ validate-ci-temp-empty)
   exit $fail
   ;;
 
+git-status)
+  if [ $(git status | grep "Untracked files" | wc -l) -gt 0 ]; then

nodes.bodyText: I agree.  Fixed.

@@ -131,6 +131,15 @@ validate-ci-temp-empty)
   exit $fail
   ;;
 
+git-status)
+  if [ $(git status | grep "Untracked files" | wc -l) -gt 0 ]; then

nodes.bodyText: Why not simple git status ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,15 @@ validate-ci-temp-empty)
   exit $fail
   ;;
 
+git-status)
+  if [ "$(git status --porcelain=v1 --untracked-files=normal)" ]; then

nodes.bodyText: --porcelain=v1 ensures backwards compatibility, and after some research, seems to be standard for git scripts. Just let me know if you would like me to change it.

@@ -131,6 +131,15 @@ validate-ci-temp-empty)

   ;;
 
+git-status)
+  if [ "$(git status --porcelain=v1 --untracked-files=normal)" ]; then

and
https://git-scm.com/docs/git-status#Documentation/git-status.txt---porcelainltversiongt

https://stackoverflow.com/a/6978402/13160102
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,15 @@ validate-ci-temp-empty)
   exit $fail
   ;;
 
+git-status)

nodes.bodyText:
I have never used it, we need simple behavior if something happened in git repo report it.

@romani the output of the git status command is not fixed and can be changed in any future version. Since git is actively used in scripts, the developers added a machine-readable format with versioning. So, "--porcelain=v1 " guarantees that the output of the command will not change in the future. Now there is already version 2, which is slightly different. But the format of version 1 will never change.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,15 @@ validate-ci-temp-empty)
   exit $fail
   ;;
 
+git-status)
+  if [ "$(git status --porcelain=v1 --untracked-files=normal)" ]; then
